cons: > Healthcare deductible is absolutely terrible for a single employee ($4450, then company covers 90%). > More interested in filling positions at clients than finding the right fit; another reviewer uses the analogy "square peg in a round hole." I joined Sogeti hoping to do primarily OOP (Java or C# primarily - as advertised). I've done almost everything besides that at my first and only client. VB.NET, SSIS, MAINFRAME (COBOL, JCL, DB2), and way too much system testing. I'm not talking about the kind of testing that is expected from developers. I'm talking QA, almost UAT, type testing. > Extremely subjective bonus system.

main_text: I have been working at Sogeti full-time for more than 3 years
pros: I really enjoy working in Tampa. I would not like to work anywhere else. Management is very approachable. Work-life balance is great. They are very flexible regarding when work is done. The benefits are the best I have seen.
cons: There has not been enough autonomy for unit management to control all aspects of their business. Senior management in the company has to approve too many decisions that should be made locally.

employee_title: Delivery Solutions for MS and MC In ITIL, AD and AS
main_text: I worked at Sogeti full-time for less than a year
pros: Good collaborative environment, with openess to learn through my experience
cons: Very rigid timeline and had to work daily 16 hours for commitments without sizing efforts.

main_text: I worked at Sogeti full-time for more than a year
pros: The compensation is okay, a little below market. The 401k is fantastic. The lack of health insurance premiums is nice. Everyone I worked with was great, including the clients and management.
cons: Company is not concerned with employees, they are just a head count (Local management is great, corporate is awful). The health insurance deductibles are too high (way too high). Training is awful, you must do all training using their programs and after business hours and you must bill 40 hours so if you want to advance you have to put in over 40 hours. Also, if you want to take any external training, you have to pay for it yourself and hope the company will compensate you for it. Corporate has no idea what their employees need or what they are doing, they just keep changing things "for the better" by increasing deductibles, removing benefits, removing training opportunities, and generally making processes more difficult. Bonus system is awful, convoluted, and don't expect your due bonus if you leave. They will actually pay you your bonus and then take it out of your bank account. In my mind, this is illegal and tantamount to stealing. This happened to me and I never gave them permission to remove funds from my bank account. If they found that they over paid me, they should have sent me an invoice with the charges that I needed to pay back, not just take the money from me. The deposit wasn't even pending anymore. They literally took money from my bank account without ever getting consent from me.

review_title: A 20th Century IT Company Operating in the 21st Century
main_text: I worked at Sogeti
pros: Great consultants who you can learn a lot from. Work life balance was good. Excellent 401K, training opportunities, and tuition reimbursement. Counselor program was a nice touch. Great job to get experience and then move on to bigger and better things.
cons: As I said in my title, Sogeti is a 20th century IT company. They have no concept of what people want and expect from this type of workplace. They talk a great game but they are all about the bottom line. All their decisions reflect this. The bonus program is arbitrary and unless you bill at least 90% of the time on time and materials projects, it is unattainable. Comp time exists but is so difficult to get that its almost like not having it. The management and account executives seem unable to get any new interesting projects so they settle for staff augmentation and putting consultants wherever they can bill just to get ATO (at the office) numbers down. The pay is less than subpar and coming in as an entry-level hire, I probably would have been better off working in retail and biding my time for a better offer. Every college entry hire that joined in my three years left for something bigger and better.

employee_status: Manager Consultant in New York, NY
main_text: I have been working at Sogeti
pros: Generous with company cellular and laptop
cons: Incompetent useless senior management failed to provide consultants with good project engagement.

review_title: Good company if you want to grow
main_text: I worked at Sogeti full-time for more than 8 years
pros: If you are the type that places emphasis on learning and growing and being patient with your salary increases, sogeti is a good company to work for. The benefits are good - 401k match of 100% up to 6% of sal + 5 weeks vacation once u hit 7 years of experience. No insurance premiums to pay, but high deductible. HSA can help cover but deductible exceeds max allowed HSA contribution.
cons: There will be times when you get paid less than your client peers or even direct reports at client. That can be frustrating! You will have to work with management to roadmap your salary adjustments over time. Wont happen in one shot. Have to prove yourself by being actively involved in unit activities , proposals and certifications. 9-5 folks will find this extra work annoying and will not grow or get rewarded as much.

review_title: Great team mates & good for technical knowledge
main_text: I worked at Sogeti full-time for more than 5 years
pros: No Travel, work/life balance, MSDN developer license, Self training materials & courses available, Great for Junior consultants just starting out. 401(k) & profit sharing great. Able to self-manage career.
cons: Corporate (CapGemini) changing PTO & bonus policies. Favoritism is a problem; great gig placement is the luck of the draw which can be frustrating. Must self-manage career;

review_title: Great if you want to be a consultant
main_text: I worked at Sogeti full-time for less than a year
pros: Good people, good bonus structure - there seem to be many opportunities here if you want to be in a consultant role and work in multiple places.
cons: You are expected to sell yourself to current and potential clients, which can be tough for an IT person

review_title: Sogeti Phoenix is not a bad vendor, especially for college grads
main_text: I have been working at Sogeti
pros: Education credit, high deductible but free health insurance, 150% 401k up to 6% but paid annually (leave before 12/31 and you lose it), ok company culture, hard not to get at least a $2500 bonus.
cons: Salary under industry norm, bench too long and you're let go, bonus program massaged differently every year, HSA in lieu of health insurance. Yearly upgrades either low or sometimes not there.

review_title: Great place for consulting non-mngt professionals!
main_text: I have been working at Sogeti full-time for more than 10 years
pros: Stability, mix breed of fortune and mid size client, flexibility, benefits, counselor program, non-management consultants, tenure
cons: Growth into mngt, stagnant compensation, promotion and raises out of sync, politics, favoritism, words out of sync with actions, on the ground ethics low

review_title: Misleading and backwards way of operating
main_text: I worked at Sogeti full-time for less than a year
pros: My co-workers in the Baltimore office were very welcoming and nice.
cons: Everything else. Their operation model is backwards. They stack up the bench with resources and THEN look for engagements. I was on the bench along with ten others for about three months and then was laid off stating "they didnt have any opportunities". This was quite different from what I was told at the interview. For three months I was simply paid $65,000 to watch training videos. I dont see how they can afford to practice like this.

review_title: Good at certain levels, a few areas need to improve a lot
main_text: I have been working at Sogeti full-time for more than a year
pros: Lot of emphasis on sales which is good but if the person is sales oriented.
cons: Less emphasis on team structure and team building. Salaries need to be normalized based on location.

review_title: Great to get your foot in the door for experience - wouldn't recommend otherwise
main_text: I worked at Sogeti full-time
pros: Offer opportunities for those with little experience in the field or college grads to break into the IT space. Training/knowledge base is expansive for those that take advantage of it - although it's all online. Great 401(k) program
cons: Projects are more staff augmentation based then true consulting. You're expected to be onsite at one client for 40 hours - working at the client direction; Sogeti is more of a glamorized staffing firm with great benefits. Forget trying to get experience and be paid what you'd get out in the market - you'll have to leave the company for that. If you come in at a higher salary, don't expect a raise. Not really a place to stay and grow your career.

review_title: Technology based consulting with a team based approach for solving client problems.
main_text: I have been working at Sogeti full-time for more than 10 years
pros: Consulting with a focus on local clients and long term relationships. I enjoy the team approach and collaboration among my colleagues in the local office and across the globe. The push for innovation within as well as what we offer our clients in services always keeps me satisfied with my career progress.
cons: Healthcare benefits seem to on the decline although this seems to be an industry trend.

main_text: I have been working at Sogeti
pros: The only pro for working with this company is that it is a job and they leave you alone.
cons: Not honest, they will flat out lie to you to keep you around.

main_text: I have been working at Sogeti full-time for more than 3 years
pros: Worked here for 3 years and it started out good at first until I found out I was lied to. It is more of my fault but if you go to work for this company make sure you get EVERYTHING in writing.
cons: To much micro management. To short sited. They have a Country of "India" mentality. They only focus on what they know (which is 10 years old) and refuse to adapt to new emerging markets. If you like being a drone and having to report to 15 different people then this company is perfect for you. They say and try to project a fun work place where they are open to ideas but at the end of the day they just want you to nod your head and keep doing what they told you even if it is wrong and impractical.

employee_status: Manager Consultant in Des Moines, IA
main_text: I have been working at Sogeti for less than a year
pros: Diversity of opportunity. Many large clients to deliver solutions for, diverse set of solutions and practices, you truly have an opportunity to grow and prosper. I'm a little frustrated reading the negative reviews, Sogeti is really a place that will reward you for the effort you put forth. Consulting is tough by nature. If you are lazy, you probably won't do well. Sogeti leadership I've worked with have a ton of integrity.
cons: There is a bit of a brand identity issue as the business evolves from staff augmentation to all solution oriented. Some solutions are not fully baked, but most are. Don't complain about it, dig in and help develop them.

review_title: Value driven company that encourages an entrepreneurial spirit of self-improvement
main_text: I have been working at Sogeti full-time for less than a year
pros: - 12k tuition reimbursement - 150% 401k match up to 6% - Bonus program - Quality people - Fosters a learning environment
cons: - Being billable is the top priority - Healthcare is free but not good for people with families - Those who run the company are not technical - Poor internal training tools

main_text: I worked at Sogeti full-time for less than a year
pros: great opportunity to network and gain skills
cons: more emphasis is put on sales than providing a quality product.

main_text: I worked at Sogeti full-time for more than a year
pros: Good for Entry-level professionals like recent graduates, they pay for your time "on the bench", great benefits and 401k employer contribution, nice and welcoming culture of the company, a lot of activities promoting communication and helping others among consultants and other employees, access to every technology you need.
cons: It's difficult to be promoted, you have to participate in the office activities as teaching some technologies you know to other consultants, and promoting sales at the clients. The salaries are good for starters, but after several years nothing changes much.

review_title: Get out what you put in
main_text: I have been working at Sogeti full-time for more than a year
pros: Great benefits & 401k, fair pay, quick promotion track for over achievers, lots of opportunities to take leadership roles, aggressive bonus structure if you contribute back to the company above and beyond your client role.
cons: Market planning and strategy lacks definition. A person who is not a self starter may have difficulty succeeding.

main_text: I worked at Sogeti full-time for less than a year
pros: - Free soda and coffee - Great benefits (401k, profit share)
cons: - Managers are extremely incompetent. When I was hired, I was told that clients were lining up outside the door and projects would be flooding in, so they needed me. After 4 months sitting in a cold, windowless office, I left after getting 0 projects while I was there. The execs don't even try to get digital projects, they are too concerned about P&G and GE contracts. - My managers had the poorest communication skills I've ever seen in a professional environment. My direct supervisor had a STRONG Indian accent, I could barely understand what he was saying and his e-mails and texts were even worse. He blamed me for the communication problems, even though several co-workers had told me that they were experiencing the same thing. - They hire you after seeing what skills you have, then when you get there ask you to do jobs involving skills you have 0 experience with. You have to learn the skill while doing the job, which makes it very stressful and inefficient. - Spread their resources too thin. I was skipped over for some contracts in favor of other, equally-skilled consultants even though they were swamped with work as it is, merely because the manager or exec knew them personally. There's a lot of personal bias. - Depressing work environment. The suits in the corner offices don't even acknowledge that you exist, and since everyone is in and out of ATO, you never see anyone.

review_title: Decent company, but not true consulting work
main_text: I have been working at Sogeti full-time for more than 3 years
pros: For the truly self-motivating, a great company as initiative is very much encouraged, but no hand-holding. Good pay and decent benefits. Opportunities outside of regular assignments to learn.
cons: Almost exclusively enterprise-level staff augmentation work (i.e. long-term assignments), not for those looking for frequent changes. If you do want out of an assignment, you have to raise a big stink. No sense of camaraderie with coworkers as you almost never see them.

main_text: I have been working at Sogeti full-time for more than a year
pros: Opportunities to learn, emphasis on training and career growth
cons: You may be asked to do things outside of your comfort zone.

main_text: I worked at Sogeti full-time for more than 3 years
pros: While at Sogeti I felt like I was my own boss. I would work downtown, in the office, or from home whenever and however I needed. The people I worked with were usually friendly and professional. I obtained invaluable business experience but had to speak up to get real development work.
cons: I was underpaid and felt management only saw me as a number. Most of my projects were either too easy or not a good fit.

review_title: My experience at Sogeti has been filled with challenges and I have gained a lot of experiences.
main_text: I have been working at Sogeti full-time for more than 5 years
pros: Bonus Program, Amount of PTO, Challenging/Not Boring, Opportunity to Travel, Networking Opportunities are Great
cons: A lot of uncertainty when you are on the bench between projects, you have little control or influence on a lot of the factors that go into the bonus program, compensation is lower than average, may have to travel far from your home to clients

main_text: I have been working at Sogeti full-time for more than a year
pros: Great benefits, surrounded by really good people, certifications are paid for, opportunities to take on different roles and leadership. If you are good at your job and have a good attitude then you will excel here. They give you the opportunity to make what you want out of your career.
cons: You may have to take on a role that is out of your comfort zone.

main_text: I have been working at Sogeti full-time
pros: Good work-life balance and the jobs are local - so none to very little traveling is required !
cons: Internal workflows / processes are not so streamlined and are sometimes confusing.

review_title: Things aren't what they appear to be.
main_text: I worked at Sogeti full-time for more than 3 years
pros: Great benefits - matching 401K at 150% - tuition reimbursement - pay for certifications. Interesting assignments - paid time on bench.
cons: If you use the benefits, it reduces your chance for a bonus. To earn a bonus, a lot of time outside of office hours is expected of you. Work life balance is what they promote but in reality, it does not happen. The more you do on your own time, the more that is expected of you. There is no transparency. People leave and they just disappear off the face of the earth - causes a lot of rumors to start - where if the company would just say "so and so has moved on for their own reasons", there would be less wondering and gossiping. Good people don't seem to last long - high turnover.

main_text: I have been working at Sogeti full-time for more than 5 years
pros: Consulting is NOT like a typical corporate job. Employees MUST take responsibility for their career. Will get out of it what you put in it. Great training opportunities & Great retirement Package!!
cons: At times have lack of direction. Can be "idle" for long periods of time.

review_title: Great place to start and gain experience
main_text: I have been working at Sogeti full-time for more than 3 years
pros: Large exposure to different technologies that allows individuals to gain experience in the entire SDLC. This helps people plan their careers based upon what they enjoy doing and don't. Generous tuition reimbursement and 401k matching available immediately joining the company. Full pay when not on an active project.
cons: In a individual augmentation resourcing model, employees have to maintain vocality about their involvement with the client for the organization to be recognized for promotions and raises. People can get forgotten about at their client sites by the unit if on projects that last over time. Bonus Program while generous is hard capped allowing X number or people to earn the maximum and basing the remainder to earn less and less, structured on additional hard caps. Due to the nature of the new practices structure, this leads to alienation between different career paths and the groups feel cliquey and fragmented.

review_title: It's more than work, it's a family innovation lab
main_text: I have been working at Sogeti full-time for more than 5 years
pros: If you enjoy endless learning and driving client value, Sogeti is the place!
cons: Finding time to get away from work, not enough back office support

review_title: Decent benefits, but very poor treatment of consultants
main_text: I worked at Sogeti full-time for more than 3 years
pros: - No insurance premiums - reasonable starting salaries - paid bench - education stipend is generous, if you can get them to approve your expenses - some people in management/sales are actually really nice and are trying to be good people, they just work for a company that doesn't support/enable that
cons: - no support from management - poor treatment of employees and customers: threatened to sue both me and my client when i left - threatened to sue me for a breach of employee agreement by going to work for my client (not technically a violation, as it's not consulting services), though other people who left at the same time to work for their clients received no such threat - bonus structure is an absolute joke - recruiters love to tout "the opportunity for a $20,000 bonus!" but you will be lucky if you get $2,500. - no support for working mothers - i had to pump in a locker room, where i got walked in on by male cleaning staff - almost no annual compensation increase, and no communication about it last year - mixed messages: consistent emails saying how well the company is doing, funding bonuses at 102%, but consultants taking salary cuts - really poor morale in the office - mandatory evening events scheduled with a week's notice - not a ton of diversity in clients, though that may be changing - even when my client manager specifically told sogeti he wanted me to take a particular training class, they said they wouldn't let me pay for it with the education stipend they talk up while recruiting you. - local and even some national leadership doesn't seem to be able to handle pressure well

main_text: I worked at Sogeti full-time for more than 5 years
pros: 100% pay on bench Good client base Profit sharing and excellent 401k matching
cons: Account execs are poor in looking out for new clients Not much investment in growing the sales team Not much brand recognition in the market

review_title: Great experiences, hard to balance responsibilities
main_text: I have been working at Sogeti full-time for more than 3 years
pros: There is plenty of access to training and learning materials. The large client base allows for a diverse project experience. The network of consultants that are at your disposal make searching for solutions easier. There are plenty of opportunities to grow and have fun outside of the work environment.
cons: Straight out of college, due to the nature of consulting, it is hard to find your place within the company. The on-boarding process for setting expectations and how the company works is slow and lacking consistency. The system for gauging client satisfaction is broken. The expectations for how sanctification is reported and how this effects consultants (bonus and promotion) is not communicated well by Account Executives leading to skewed metrics or numbers being made up. Due to the counselor system having to balance client delivery with reaching out to counselees it is hard to feel connected at time. This tension, coupled with the extra (outside of 40 hours) activities for practices, account development and community activities makes the work life balance very challenging.

review_title: Good place to work when there IS work
main_text: I worked at Sogeti full-time for more than 3 years
pros: Decent pay, good benefits, great training opportunities.
cons: Not always enough work to keep everyone engaged on projects.

review_title: No specific tech background, but they still brought me on board.
main_text: I have been working at Sogeti full-time for more than a year
pros: If you are interested in developing your skills in IT, Sogeti has everything you need to advance. They provide the tools and the connections, but it is 100% up to you to take advantage of it.
cons: You are not being paid close to what they bill you for.

review_title: The support needed to grow my career
main_text: I have been working at Sogeti full-time for more than 3 years
pros: Speaking plainly, in my two and a half years of experience with Sogeti, I've received the exposure, training, and interaction needed to take my career to the next level. When I began with Sogeti, I felt my career was stagnant in terms of skills and training opportunities. The local HR Manager and Practice leaders REALLY stepped up to assist me with the experience and training I needed. This organization offers $12,000/year in training and tuition reimbursement, it really is unheard of in the marketplace. Local leadership really shines. My on-boarding was thorough and helpful and I feel like I can approach any one of my senior managers and get their time and opinions on any challenges I am facing.
cons: I wish Sogeti put as much emphasis on training in sales and client relationship management as they do in Technical training. It's an area I don't have much experience in and would like ALOT more coaching and development.

main_text: I have been working at Sogeti full-time for more than a year
pros: --Benefits: immediate 150% 401k match up to 6% contribution and just 3-year vested schedule, Profit Sharing, Vacation Days, Tuition Reimbursement... --Training material available: there's an entire learning center for consultants to access --Bonus Program: Reading some of the other reviews, it seems people aren't a fan of it and one reviewer said "you have to work your butt off to get a bonus".... NO KIDDING? You don't say?! What kind of concept is that? Work extra hard to get BONUS pay, above and beyond your generous salary?! Another reviewer said you need to be "in" with the people that rate. Why yes, you should be reaching out to your local management and be proactive. How do you think they're going to rate you if they don't even know you exist? The Bonus Program is definitely a positive about this company. --Overall work/personal life balance --Project opportunities --Client Base --Counselor Program --Support from regional / geographical managers and Account Executives: be proactive and keep in touch with the important people in your region and in your unit. You will get lots of support from them and will be given great opportunities, as you show you care and put forth more effort.
cons: The only "con" I experience isn't company-specific, it's the nature of business and consulting. There are times you're given short notice or little information on projects and have to adjust quickly and be on your own to figure out what's going on. All you do to overcome that is communicate well and be proactive and ask questions / reach out to points of contact who will guide you. If anything, this can actually be a "pro" because it keeps you on your feet and forces you to learn / grow at a faster pace than the typical "comfort zone".

main_text: I worked at Sogeti full-time for more than 3 years
pros: If you work here, you're a consultant. The money was good. I liked a lot of the people.
cons: The benefits have gone downhill. The bonus structure is complicated and difficult to understand. This won't be a good experience for you unless you are a consultant who likes to sell. Sales is what they reward. Also, it's a true consulting company, so you get what comes along with being a consultant. There is not really a bench policy anymore. I was let go after 3 days on the bench. My boss was replaced by someone who just wanted to cut costs (that's what his bonus is based on). The new guy let people go so that he could get a better bonus. At Sogeti you are seen as $$$, not as a person.

review_title: Good Company but "good old boy" connections needed to move up.
main_text: I have been working at Sogeti full-time for more than a year
pros: Nice salary and fairly good benefits. 401K is great if you can stick around for 3 years. Management mostly leaves you alone to go about your business. There is a hands off mentality to their management style which is nice while you are busy working away at the clients office.
cons: The bonus structure is a joke and you have to be "in" with the graders to really make a bonus that is worth anything. Don't let the recruiter talk you into the fact that it is easy to hit the $10 or $20K bonuses. Literally only the golden employees hit those. If you land $2.5K bonus you did really well. The reimbursement program is a hassle and the company credit card does not create any efficiencies. You might as well use your personal card to get the benefits from it (miles or points).

review_title: Good experiences when billing at a client
main_text: I have been working at Sogeti full-time for more than 5 years
pros: Good partnership with Microsoft and IBM, generally no travel and local projects and ability to grow if you don't mind working above and beyond. You get promoted quickly and sometimes even if you are not qualified with the assumption that you can perform (can be a pro or a con).
cons: During interviews, company will showcase their training and mentor-ship (counselor) programs which look great until you join the company. There is absolutely no investment in employees for training etc. (There are trainings delivered by other consultants but they are usually sub-optimal). You will most likely never attend a training session/course that's not free (or involves travel). As long as you are billing, life looks great and the culture feels good. But when you are not, you need to look for other options.

main_text: I worked at Sogeti full-time for less than a year
pros: They lure you with false promises
cons: I was hired for a position that never existed. I ended up waiting for a project for 2 months , kept getting a response from management that they would place me at the earliest. Nothing materialized and they showed me the door saying I was not a good fit. I realized in 2 months that they just a staffing company and not a solution provider as they claim. Management is pathetic and HR is even worse. They have such a weak relationship with their clients.

main_text: I have been working at Sogeti full-time for more than 3 years
pros: Most of your working will be independent with the client, so you have control over your day. Get experience at different companies, while maintaining the same job.
cons: Sogeti is not a true consulting company there are few to no projects, and all of the work is staff augmentation. As a consultant you will not get the experience and methodologies present at other consulting companies. Sogeti is a staff augmentation or resource company. The structure of the company is based on selling resources (staff augmentation), the bonus structure and advancement is based on this. A technical resource will not have opportunities to advance, get training, and get the high bonuses at Sogeti. The only people who have been at Sogeti long term are the sales people who did not come up the consulting track, HR reps who have no technical or consulting background, the back office workers who came in as front desk secretaries, and senior managers who are selling resources. Technical people, project managers, and business analysts leave in 3 years after they are vested in the 401k plan and get very poor raises during those years, once you get to know people there it is well known that raises are not given out. The projects you will work on are rarely cutting edge or large enterprise project, much of the work is maintenance and support. Clients are generally not impressed with Sogeti and are vocal about it. As a consultant you will not grow within Sogeti, or within the client, your growth will be limited to what you do outside of Sogeti. Most of the non-consultants: low level HR reps, back office workers, and sales people have offices with window views and are vastly under qualified for their job. No one outside of billing consultants have consulting experience, which creates a difficult environment for conversations regarding clients and projects. The non-consultants are treated like gold, while the consultants are treated like a depreciating product. Also if you are a consultant and your client has a day off, you have to use PTO, unfortunately clients have significantly more days off than Sogeti does so go ahead and knock several days off your PTO as you will be forced to use them. If you read the other favorable reviews they are written as though it is an advertisement and I believe they are fake as I just learned Sogeti monitors the reviews here. Be wary of those reviews as I have not met another person at Sogeti who is actually happy with their work or opportunities that is on the consulting side.

main_text: I worked at Sogeti full-time for less than a year
pros: Give you access to all kind of training materials. Access to a MSDN license to download any Microsoft software if you were in the app dev group. Get to meet many different people to network.
cons: Healthcare could be better for families. Great if you were single or no kids. They were only concern with bill rate and and you being billable. You had to avoid the bench, but if you are on the bench management doesn't make you few like you have a secured job. But AE tend to focus on existing clients, just getting new projects with same client rather then finding new client. Also when interviewed I asked is they were project based or staff augmented. Was told they are focusing more on projects but in end because you have to play the bench game you have to take anything they offered. Otherwise you run risk of getting laid off.

review_title: Great people to work with but Management is not at all cooperative
main_text: I worked at Sogeti full-time for more than a year
pros: Great people, Good Work Environment
cons:
Bad Perks
Management seems to be very mean dont try to understand the employess only bothered about rate.

review_title: It's okay, but not the best.
main_text: I have been working at Sogeti full-time for less than a year
pros: Fellow consultants are very knowledgeable and willing to help with anything. There are many online materials to help you learn new things, and you are able to get a myriad of experience rather quickly.
cons: They only go after clients that meet certain criteria. This is really hurting them in some markets as other consulting firms are simply getting the business. There isn't a lot of work for people in the Agile space (scrum masters, coaches, etc), so don't' bother signing up if you are interested in growing your agile career. The bonus plan is a crock. The only way to actually get a bonus is to work your butt off. This bonus plan seems to change every year, too.

review_title: Good Experience for adding new skills.
main_text: I have been working at Sogeti full-time for more than 8 years
pros: Descent benefits, lots of vacation time can accrue. No health care premiums. Pay on the bench. Plenty of training opportunities, but you have to drive the effort.
cons: Small pay raises, but they are there. Bonus program is confusing, subjective. Must be very proactive on the bench to find new engagements.

review_title: Employment is like a Contract position
main_text: I have been working at Sogeti full-time for more than a year
pros: Big offers to make you dream of career growth, Educational assistance upto 12 grand a year, 150% 401K Contribution etc.. But dreams will remain as dream.. They will terminate you before your 401K vesting start (within 3 years) They will never approve your educational expense request.. You will be terminated as soon as your billing ends.. A big Sham and a big shame for Cap Gemini for carrying this brand
cons: They will not promote any career growth, educational assistance and terminate you before your 401K company contribution gets vested

main_text: I have been working at Sogeti full-time for less than a year
pros: Great place to work at.
cons: No cons I can think of.

main_text: I worked at Sogeti full-time for less than a year
pros: - place where you will definitely end up getting a job - reason for above is consultants do not stay here for long unless they have a personal limitation ( family or otherwise) and there is no reason they should unless they have a personal limitation ( family or otherwise) - anyone looking to join should plan well in advance their priorities and manage their expectations - my advice would be to go with the flow in this unit and don't be surprised if you get a whole new flavor of consulting experience
cons: - certainly not a place for technical consultants - neither a place for young aspiring candidates to hope for an awesome start to their careers - don't be surprised with workplace politics in this unit ; higher ups spend more time dealing/creating politics and serving self interests than focusing on growing the company or people or finding projects

main_text: I have been working at Sogeti full-time for more than 5 years
pros: Do not have to travel if you do not want to.
cons: Performance review system for bonuses is kinda wonky.

review_title: Great opportunity to grow. Not a lot of direction though.
main_text: I worked at Sogeti full-time
pros: Tons of opportunities to grow outside of you client engagement. Always looking for people to help lead initiatives and get involved outside of the normal day to day job. Excellent stable client base in Chicago with some great opportunities and ability to stay local. Very hands off (which is good and bad).
cons: Salaries are average and below average for many. Bonus plan is inconsistent and somewhat out of your control. Management is very hands off unless you engage them (like I said, good and bad).

review_title: Good company to pick up your skills with
main_text: I have been working at Sogeti full-time for more than a year
pros: * Good Compensation and Benefits * Good teams and senior developers to help you out * People are really friendly
cons: * Extreme workload at times

review_title: Good company, but always keep a lookout for another job
main_text: I have been working at Sogeti full-time for less than a year
pros: Probably benefits and generous pay
cons: 2 week notice for layoff

main_text: I have been working at Sogeti full-time for more than 5 years
pros: Ability to sell and deliver are available to each consultant
cons: Limited solution based deliveries for clients were available - mostly resource / staff aug based - that gets old after awhile. HR management has been very weak over the years. Promotions are limited and you must push for the promotion rather than your body of work

review_title: Somewhat satisfactory with room to improve
main_text: I have been working at Sogeti full-time for more than a year
pros: Collegiate environment Personal growth Flat management structure
cons: Healthcare Communication between management and units

main_text: I worked at Sogeti full-time for more than a year
pros: Exposure to different client and technologies. Company internal web-based training programs enables you to be more marketable. Benefits package is pretty decent and they do offer a bonus program. I felt I was working with some of the best technical people in the business.
cons: Sogeti is a 24/7 operation and usually doesn't offer a professional and personal life balance. You will be required to be at a client site then also build partnerships outside the billable time. This coupled with required skill training makes it difficult to maintain a balanced life.

review_title: Worked as college hire for one year.
main_text: I worked at Sogeti full-time
pros: Frequently new projects; may switch practices once a year; potential for growth.
cons: If you decided to specialize in a certain area of IT consulting and there are no projects on the pipeline in that area you will be let go. Must hound account reps for job placements. Insurance benefits are minimal.

main_text: I have been working at Sogeti full-time for more than 5 years
pros: Nice benefits Full pay on bench People are nice
cons: Sales very weak Not aggressive in finding new clients

main_text: I have been working at Sogeti full-time
pros: Excellent Benefits. Employee Focus. Regional Model works well. Entrepreneurial in nature.
cons: Offshore delivery is a challenge. In a transformation mode currently.

main_text: I worked at Sogeti full-time for less than a year
pros: *Occasional opportunities to work from home *No insurance premiums
cons: *EXTREMELY little opportunity for career mobility *Responsible for buying work essentials (mouse, keyboard, monitor) *Impossible for new consultants to get bonuses *No compensation for overtime *Provided manager ample time to know of my resignation, VP & Corporate held it against me and made my last day a week before I had requested, preventing me (while pregnant) to be denied benefits and a week's pay *Micromanaging Team Leads *CHEAP work events - Costco food that employees would have to prepare

review_title: Great consulting company with good benefits.
main_text: I have been working at Sogeti full-time for more than 5 years
pros: They offer very good benefits including a high-matching 401k and health/dental, as well as a lot of financial support for education (hardly any request gets turned down). The people are very friendly and definitely strive to grow the company. Account execs work well to engage you on new opportunities, and the company encourages entrepreneurial spirit.
cons: Not much culture since you all usually work at different clients in different departments. The bonus plan is complicated and has never been popular. The counseling program is supposed to support your growth, but none of the ones I've had were very engaged.

review_title: A nice place to visit but I couldn't stay.
main_text: I worked at Sogeti full-time for more than a year
pros: Good salary Training opportunities (even while billing) Big company means plenty of room for a rear growth if you're entrepreneurial Local model (little if any travel)
cons: Perhaps too big. (You feel like a cog in a wheel) Emphasis on revenue over ethics Reactive leadership

main_text: I have been working at Sogeti full-time for more than 3 years
pros: Very good benefits, great 401k match with only a 3 year vest, profit sharing, starts at 15 days off. Great range of jobs for a college graduate to better find what they want their career to become. Health Care is 100% paid for, but is more suited for those who are younger with no families. The account executives are very proactive in helping you get the type of jobs you want to pursue, as well as being your biggest advocates to management come review and promotion time.
cons: Can sometimes get stuck on projects for a long length of time. You need to voice your opinion strongly in order to get the type of jobs you want, but they are not guaranteed. Do not go into this job expecting a bonus. Sogeti recruiters will push the 20k+ bonus, but the bonus system is a nationwide tiered ranking for all consultants at every level and is not just performance based. Only top level consultants that work on contracts and lead practices will get the 10 and 20k+ bonuses. Typical bonus for most consultants is 5k but thats after a couple of years. First years expect no bonus or 2500, so prospective candidates such weigh this and negotiate based on base salary only. You must have one year into the company before you are eligible for profit sharing. Health Care is a high deductible plan not suited for families.

review_title: Overall, and good experience with Sogeti
main_text: I worked at Sogeti full-time for less than a year
pros: You can get a variety of experience working on different projects for different clients. This includes the size of the team, from just 1 or 2 people to 20 people.
cons: Can feel lost and confused in the system. I was never sure what I was doing, or what I would be doing next. As long as your billing that's what matters.

review_title: Sogeti is very sink or swim.
main_text: I have been working at Sogeti full-time for more than a year
pros: Young consultants can quickly get a wide range of experience by working on a handful of different projects in a short period of time. Getting pushed into projects out of your depth can pay off if you end up doing well.
cons: There's very little direction, especially for younger/newer employees. Management can be hard to get in touch with, and there are times that I at least felt kind of forgotten about. Younger employees are often pushed onto projects with little guidance for what they're expected to do, which is stressful.

main_text: I have been working at Sogeti full-time for more than 3 years
pros: Decent benefits (150% 401k match, 12k Tuition Reimbursment, Training Opportunites)
cons: Lower Salary compared to market rates, limited growth potential

review_title: Good company for self-driven people with leadership qualities.
main_text: I have been working at Sogeti full-time for more than 3 years
pros: Hard work and leadership potential is recognized and rewarded with responsibility, challenge, and opportunities. The benefits are good. They include generaous vacation time, health care, and 401k. Your bonus is performance driven bonus amongst your unit and region. You get to work with a network of really smart people.
cons: Every year there are changes to policies regarding benefits and infrastructure, leadership, and general political alignment. Communication from leadership, especially national and regional level, is not that great. Not many people have heard of Sogeti.

main_text: I worked at Sogeti full-time for more than 8 years
pros: i worked for Sogeti USA for over 5 years , when I joined them in the Mid 2000's it was a dream company for any youngster - awesome benefits, cutting edge technologies, excellent managers to work with. Fast forward - today the only  I would like to comment on is the 401(K) match which is on par with the industry standards, everything else has gone down
cons: Lots of internal politics, worse the CEO and COO / VP of operations are related to each other - even though the management talks about an open door policy these 2 call the shots and rule with an iron fist i.e. threatening people, they talk about infusing fresh blood to the company to take it forward but they have to retire first before someone else can move in. Working culture resembles an Indian factory where everything is done by cracking the whip, in addition to that there are a lot of folks who have been given leadership roles without having the right kind of experience. For instance the COO has never sold IT Services, not a financial guy neither has a HR background - is an Oracle Apps person and yet he is now at the helm of running the company - there are branch managers who have never been people's managers and are now running P & L's resulting in high attrition. Company is no longer growing, hence there are no new clients - consultants no longer get to work on newer technologies, training & development is out of question because one can't afford not to bill, all of this makes it difficult to bring in the right talent to the company when building a practice. It seems that we always talk about Solutioning and practices but end up doing staff augmentation. The Parent company really no longer cares about what goes on with Sogeti USA and may be it is time for them to do a reality check and do may be recommend a change in overall leadership.

review_title: Like working for yourself, but with a consistent paycheck
main_text: I have been working at Sogeti full-time for more than a year
pros: I like the freedom to manage my work and the relationship with the client. I like the compensation and the 401k matching.
cons: Relocation to other offices is possible, but only if you pay the majority of relocation costs. Raises are a low percentage. 401k matching does not vest until year 3 in the company.

review_title: Sogeti is a great company to work for.
main_text: I have been working at Sogeti full-time for more than a year
pros: New hires have the opportunity to start their career in a growing community. If client spots are not available right away they will keep you on a bench.
cons: As much as offices and corporate preach opportunities and growth, it does not always feel that their is as much action on this as what is being said.

review_title: Provides a lot of stability for a consulting company
main_text: I have been working at Sogeti full-time for more than 10 years
pros: Pay and benefits are good. Get to work with top companies around the city. No travel unless you agree to it first.
cons: In order to move up you must produce sales. There are cliques inside the company and if you are not in one of them you are severely limited on getting opportunities to increase your bonus chances or landing prime assignments.

review_title: Violations.. this "business" needs to be audited.
main_text: I have been working at Sogeti full-time for more than 3 years
pros: None... you are wasting your time.

main_text: I worked at Sogeti full-time for more than a year
pros: If you are already a pro who needs no career advice, this company leaves you alone.
cons: My 'manager', who I never met, only called my client once a year to see to see if they wanted to renew the contract. Only called me twice, and simply to see if the client wanted to renew. No career path, no support, no culture, terrible technology provided.

main_text: I have been working at Sogeti full-time for more than 3 years
pros: Lot of opportunities to learn, best part you will get placed in same city no need to travel
cons: When you are on bench they do pay salary, but drawback is you loose your IBP (Individual Bonus Points)...

review_title: Recent grad? Come join us , Seniors and high skilled stay away.
main_text: I have been working at Sogeti full-time for more than 5 years
pros: 401k Match to 150% for the 6% + Profit sharing up to 5% sounds great but has a ton of tricks. No copay health Insurance, HSA decent vacation time, mileage reimbursement.
cons: 401K hidden gems (Company wont tell you). 1) If you are new to the company you don't get the profit sharing, 2) 3 years vesting plan 3) The match is paid in full once a year at the end of December ( this is not only terrible is almost immoral for people that need to leave the company for what ever reason, not to mention as a Financial move is bad to place 1 huge amount of money in 1 deposit what is the stock price is too high ? then you lose money on top of all the drama.) 4) The profit sharing was less than promise in 2013. 5) The company bets that if they distribute the 401K money they will stop the attrition but a lot of people will leave at the same time after they deposit the money. High deductible plan per family is insanely high and its much higher than other companies $6500. They will move from Aetna PPO to United health care in 2014 and they do not include vision and primary physician annual check up , now will be one or the other so you have to chose between you physical or your eyes and Rx glasses reimbursement is over as with Aetna you get up to 150 dollars reimbursement. Bonus: OMG you have to kiss all management boots to get a small bonus, even if you were billable all year if your profit is not high you are screw. Instead of changing you clients to help out with your billing they let you with your client till death. (No bonus for me this year) Don't even start me with overtime the CEO keeps stealing the good things remaining in the company and he always do it in 2 or 3 steps ( two or three years in the making of this scam) so people don't immediately understand they being fool and steal them a huge benefit in the company. He removed all Comp time and rename it to something else ( this trick is something people in marketing use to change the vision of the people with bad companies like BP or Chevron ) then the next year change the rules on the new program so you can't accrued time unless you are 96% productive (1880 hours) , then he next year changes again saying you need to be 96% productive and what ever you do for overtime now will convert to points for bonus ( this is a huge cheap trick ) it translate you might not have a bonus and the company will make more profit in your behalf for your time and effort and wont even reward you with vacation time. Another great thing lost again steal from us is the Employee of the week gift !! This was a huge deal Things they gave me cameras, then gps's later ipod then open choice electronic reimbursement up to $100 dollars then Boss headphones and this 2013 (drums )..... NOTHING !! He said will give us a free day on 12/31 instead. I beat my car that in 2014 he will remove 12/31 as holiday and boom he disappear another benefit. So you get the idea how things are , if something is good wait 15 min. he will change it again to save a buck on your behalf so he can get another bigger bonus.

review_title: Good for new grads, but make your stay short
main_text: I worked at Sogeti full-time for more than a year
pros: Gets you corporate experience but other than that I would recommend finding a better place after a year or 2
cons: Low pay. A lot of politics go on. CEO decreases benefits. Nearly impossible to get a bonus. Have no sense of direction

main_text: I have been working at Sogeti full-time for more than 3 years
pros: Great Benefit, retirement plan 401k, health insurance, bonus, education reimbursement
cons: Company moving towards staff augmentation, management only care about billing client, management don't care about consultant's interest and wanting to move to a different role, projects etc

review_title: If your only other option is unemployment... I guess it might be better- slightly
main_text: I worked at Sogeti full-time for more than a year
pros: It pays better than unemployment as long as you are maximizing your billable hours and covering for inept sales staff. Team buy, team sell, team deliver means while you will not receive a cut of the sales, you're expected to actively sell. Yay for you if that's what you're in to. Do you like acronyms? Do you like cliches? Lots and LOTS of acronyms- ABC baby- always be selling. "Not really in your wheelhouse but we need someone for this contract"- watch Glengarry Glen Ross to get the full effect of working here. If you are only capable of mediocre work, and really have no desire to become better- this is the place for you. You can be "all you will ever be" right here- probably relatively comfortably. You'll be a whole lot more suited here than a company that actually expects you to perform. If you like pushing paper and making power point presentations more than actually accomplishing something- sign up!
cons: Joke of a healthcare plan- though that may get better with the new healthcare act. Lots of training offered, but it'll have to be on your own time, and you know, if you want brownie points, you gotta spend a lot of extra time taking joke training sessions. You will not learn, you will not grow. Honestly, I feel most sorry for the "new college grads" that are hired here. Some seem relatively bright- though the truly bright will get better offers from other companies.

main_text: I worked at Sogeti full-time for less than a year
pros: 401k is matched at 150% up to the first 6%.
cons: Mediocre pay structure. Factory mentality. Disgusting PTO plan. It's a billing machine not an employer.

review_title: Sogeti - not so good to consultants
main_text: I worked at Sogeti full-time for more than a year
pros: Good benefits, decent time off plan. Can have varied and enjoyable variety. Good internal training available to consultants. Overall, excellent co-workers.
cons: Very poor leadership, complete lack of strategy. The mgt team in Texas suffers from a lack of a clear and concise strategy. For an IT consulting company, this can be a serious weakness. Senior mgt ethics can be confusing as well.

review_title: International company with a small company feel
main_text: I have been working at Sogeti full-time for more than 5 years
pros: - Majority of projects are local in your home town, but there are opportunities for travel gigs as well. This allows you to have a personal/family life since you're not always on the road. - Strong respect for your work/life balance. You are rarely expected to work more than 40 hours unless there is a deadline approaching. - Ability to move horizontally through the company to try different technologies. - Management is very personable with the consultants. - Projects with modern technologies in a range of industries and company sizes. - Progress through the company at your own pace. There is an annual "Promotion Review Board" where you present yourself for promotion. - Monthly happy hours and other social events. - Internal Toastmasters club. - Night time technical training provided by other consultants.
cons: - Without a strong skill-set, you could end up on projects that you don't prefer. However, this is a problem with any consulting firm. - Internal structure has slight changes annually. It's not complicated changes, but just cumbersome to keep up with the name and title changes. - Promotions and pay raises are two separate processes. A promotion will provide you with a higher bill rate which should provide you a higher bonus, but if you want a higher salary, then you need to negotiate that separately.

main_text: I have been working at Sogeti full-time for more than a year
pros: - Great benefits (100% paid health insurance, 150% 401K match up to 6%, profit sharing directly deposited to 401K, bonus program up to $20K per year) - Training is available for all types of disciplines and certifications - 100% reimbursement for education and certifications - Pay while between projects
cons: - Success is directly linked to your contribution in sales even as a consultant - Limited opportunities to be involved in sales - Terminated if between projects for too long (no definitive time frame; depends on individual) - Health care is high deductible - Organizational communication is poor and policies are inconsistent across units

review_title: One of the best places to work as a consultant.
main_text: I have been working at Sogeti full-time for more than 5 years
pros: You have the ability to earn a bonus. When your contract expires with a client you are not let go, rather sit on the 'bench'.
cons: No control of your bill rate to clients. You are a consultant and required to be involved in sales to advance.

review_title: Stay away from the Dayton Unit!
main_text: I worked at Sogeti full-time
pros: In my time with Sogeti I had some great engagements that helped me grow both professionally and personally. However, that was mostly at the hands of my clients.
cons: Over the last year, the sales funnel has dried up. Those suffering the most are the consultants. Experience ranks lower than low cost resources.

review_title: Good company but could be better
main_text: I worked at Sogeti full-time for more than 3 years
pros: 1) At Sogeti, you really own your career and they give you ample opportunities to do so ie Promotion Review Board, After-hours gatherings, Counselor, tools to help get certifications etc etc 2) They offer $10,000 for Tuition Reimbursement per year 3) The HR Personell are very responsive and will hear out any complaints that you might have 4) You gain lots of experience and skills, if you want to build your skills quickly 5) Front Office is very nice and professional 6) I personally felt that if you made good and cogent arguments for a wage increase, they were usually receptive and offered you something 7) They have a very good 401k matching program 8) The Counselor Program is very good and is definitely a bright spot at Sogeti 9) If you hit the bench, they are not quick to fire you (at least in DFW) 10) MSDN Ultimate Subscription
cons: 1) They do a ton of Staff Augmentation work 2) Being placed on an assignment that has nothing to do with your skill set or what you want to do career-wise happens quite a bit and these engagements can be long 3) The company has become extremely corporate and have made several poor decisions, when looked at from the perspective of the consultant 4) For the 401k match, they use to match per paycheck but now you have to wait until December 15 to get your match. So if you leave prior to this date, you don't get a match for that year 5) You use to get Comp Time for any hours worked over 40 in a week. Now, you have to work 47 Weeks (1880 hours) worth of billable hours for Comp Time to accrue and if you dig deeper, this effectively removes Comp Time 6) Recently, they implemented a policy that new hires get laptops with very limited permissions. So if you have to use your laptop at a client, be prepared to be on the phone with help desk, trying to get basic software installed 7) Many of the Account Executives are just salesman and really could care less about you and only care that you are at one of their accounts making money for them. Some can be very unethical as well. 8) If your client is closed and Sogeti is not, you must take PTO. Even if you want to hit the bench, you will not be able too, unless granted special permission 9) If you have a long commute to a client, they only pay .35 cents for mileage, if they cannot bill it to the client 10) Their HR System (Time, Expenses, PTO Monitoring etc etc) is one of the worst systems I have ever encountered. 11) Bonus is heavily tied to sales and your billing rate, which often times, you have no control over 12) You can get stuck doing Staff Aug for years at a client 13) You can have a known track record for upsetting clients and being kicked off engagements but as long as you are visible in the office, you can not only keep your job but get promoted as well, I saw this a few times

main_text: I have been working at Sogeti full-time for more than 5 years
pros: Great 401(k) matching, large bonus potential, good opportunities to work on interesting projects, great for technologists with business savvy, MSDN for all Microsoft Alliance consultants, lots of training resources available for self improvement, diverse client base in many industry verticals, no travel due to local market focus
cons: Difficult to control your performance metrics to maximize earning potential. Internal technology stack is dated but finally being upgraded to more current products.

review_title: Sogeti is what you make it
main_text: I have been working at Sogeti full-time for more than 3 years
pros: Sogeti rewards stars. If you are pro-active, focused on furthering your career and education, want to earn bonuses, you will. I did. There is support, but you need to reach out for it, they don't push it on you. If you go on the bench, you still get paid as a FTE. If you go on the bench for a long time, if you've been a good employee (high client reviews) they will support you for months. It's what you make it.
cons: If you are a pencil pusher and choose not to shine, you're Sogeti experience will reflect your lackluster performance. It is a true mirror of your effort. If you are a complainer, you will complain about Sogeti.

review_title: Excellent company, great opportunity, great people, quality work in prestigious clients.
main_text: I have been working at Sogeti full-time for more than 3 years
pros: Sogeti has a focus on their people like no other company I've worked for. The emphasis is on training, personal growth, advancement, opportunity and providing excellent benefits and rewards for good performance. They care if the work is challenging or you are unhappy at a client, you aren't just body. Project based work in a team environment. Sogeti is an innovative and creative leader in the IT services industry and it's cool to be a part of it.
cons: I really can't think of any significant cons. Sogeti is what you make it, they provide support and training, it's up to you to take advantage of those opportunities and to make things happen for yourself.

main_text: I have been working at Sogeti full-time for less than a year
pros: Strong Benefits, Growth. Self-Directed. Not heavy handed from Management. Well compensated for seeking opportunities
cons: Not too well known yet in the United States. Hands off approach and entrepreneur-oriented work environment doesn't work with everyone. Must be willing to sell yourself

main_text: I have been working at Sogeti full-time for more than a year
pros: Great place to learn a variety of useful tools and skills. This job is what you make of it and you will probably be put in a situation which the odds are a bit against you but if you are motivated and hardworking can be very rewarding.
cons: Getting stuck on the bench is the bench can be pretty awful if you sit and stare at your hands. Try to find a certification they want you to have and study, otherwise you will just feel like you are going to be fired and probably will if you don’t act like you are motivated to get on a contract.

main_text: I have been working at Sogeti full-time for less than a year
pros: Many of the people are nice...
cons: Tech people never get a bonus. The office is a revolving door... Tech talent is mismanaged and the people who are supposed to be "selling" your skill rarely have any Idea of what those skill are... Everything is a huge secret when it comes to jobs and management. The consultants are often kept in the dark about every decision including in many cases their own placement... I have even heard of consultants going to interviews without even being told the name of the client and having to discover it on the spot when they get there.

main_text: I have been working at Sogeti full-time for more than 3 years
pros: The size of the company allows for a diverse set of experiences with numerous companies. The people at the lower levels are very helpful to each other, but are basically on their own.
cons: Poor policies for treatment of employees. They are viewed as an item for sale and not as people, for the most case. Billing 40 hours is paramount, even at upper levels of management. Management at the top does not accept input from below. It has been categorized as an exploitative management style. 30 % turnover is acceptable.

review_title: Not the most organized company, doesn't care about all employees
main_text: I have been working at Sogeti full-time for less than a year
pros: Good salary for recent grads
cons: Being on the bench is terrible. Management gives you nothing to do while on the bench, but expects you to make them money, and if you don't, you're likely to be let go. Not very good communication at all, onboarding was a terrible experience. It took 30 minutes and nothing was went over, so now in the company, you are lost on what to do.

review_title: A less than Stellar Experience with Sogeti
main_text: I have been working at Sogeti full-time for less than a year
pros: The people are very nice and genuine. They are very knowledgeable and hard working.
cons: They do not have enough work to keep their employees gainfully employed on projects.

main_text: I worked at Sogeti full-time for more than 5 years
pros: Great 401K benefits, for now!
cons: Raises are always less than inflation despite performance, unless you are a very junior developer. Health Insurance doesn't really exist, its more of a bankruptcy insurance since the yearly deductible is 5 grand or so. Your upward progression is completely based on sales ability and not technical ability. The bonus plan changes yearly and has been diluted every year since its existence. No overtime, instead you are credited towards the bonus plan where the $ pool is fixed. Poor management is unable to retain top talent.

review_title: If you like being an IT or Project Manager Mercenary, then this company is for you!
main_text: I have been working at Sogeti full-time for more than 10 years
pros: Perfect employer for A type individuals, if you can sell project management or purple squirrel IT programming needs then you can make bank.
cons: Work/Life balance is horrible, what they describe as benefits aren't, you live under the "what have you done for me lately" or your out the door.

review_title: Good place to work with opportunities to grow
main_text: I have been working at Sogeti full-time for more than 5 years
pros: Great benefits Strong, growing company Local consulting model with minimal, if any, travel Great support from co-workers Structured bonus program for all consultants Interesting projects using the newest technologies Local leadership is great Part of the Capgemini group, so all of the support of a 100,000+ employee company
cons: Need to seek opportunities in your own No real leadership development program Not the best communication from upper management, especially when policies/benefits change

main_text: I worked at Sogeti full-time
pros: Friendly environment and trustworthy colleagues Very flexible with schedule.
cons: Too many politics in upper management Training is good, but could be better

review_title: I really like Sogeti Columbus Unit!!
main_text: I have been working at Sogeti full-time for more than 5 years
pros: Top 1% 401K in the country. No copay for Health insurance , really smart and cool people to work with (vast majority - eventually there is jerk or two as in every other company). Awesome life-work balance specially if you being 4+ years with the company.
cons: $6000 Family health deductible? It's difficult. If you ever hit the bench (or as peers call it "the beach") you will want to kill yourself cuz there is nothing to do. review_title: Good career route for IT professionals
main_text: I have been working at Sogeti
pros: If your career path is in IT, then consulting with Sogeti provides a good opportunity to learn more competitive IT skills while working at Fortune 500 clients. Sogeti works with the largest companies and provides employees with reasonable opportunities to gain experience and increase in responsibility. The talent level varies, but overall most Sogeti consultants are competent and good at working together. For recent college graduates or IT professionals early in your career, Sogeti would be a great place to start and build your experience. It may also be a good fit for IT professionals that are at the point in their career where quality of life is more important than career advancement. Generally, Sogeti consulting is a 40 hour a week job with reasonable pay and benefits.
cons: Pay is average and does not necessary increase regularly through the base salary. Sogeti pay increases come through bonuses that competitively sought after. Although there are a number of quantitative factors considered, the subjective aspects from management generally are the deciding factors in whether you get a bonus. Sogeti runs a lean operation to keep their billable rates competitive, so that affects both salary potential and employee support services. Employee development is below average because of this approach to cost management.

review_title: Sales Focused, No Overtime, Large Company. Right for some, but not all.
main_text: I have been working at Sogeti
pros: I agree with all the other pros mentioned by other posters. I would like to echo that there are many good consultants that work for Sogeti, but over the years I have seen the best of the best leave for other consultant companies who are more employee focused. Sogeti is very sales driving in everything they do. Bonuses are not based on your technical expertise but instead how much money you bill clients. Training is talked about, but if you leave the client to training you are penalized in multiple ways. Certifications are paid for, but you need to expense them and that negatively impacts your bonus. The biggest pro with organization benefits is 6% 401K matching and profit sharing bonus up to 5%. The biggest pro in regards to work is that they are a very large company and can get into bigger companies that smaller consulting companies can't touch. So there is potential to work your way to very good lead positions if you are driven. You can't get that with small consultant companies. If you are driven and want to lead projects and team, go Sogeti. If you are technology driven, then you got something to think about.
cons: My main gripe right now is that Sogeti has altered their overtime policy in such a way that it is much harder to get credit for any overtime you work. The CEO and HR say in not so many words that reducing our overtime benefits (called comp time) is to help us. It is not that Sogeti no longer provides overtime benefits. Sogeti does offer them, but they put in place rules to make it hard to earn them. Despite numerous complaints HR is non responsive. Why do they not pay overtime? Because we are doing a lot of fixed bid projects and they don't want to risk having to pay consultants to much money. And if we are doing time and material work the company would like to pocket any overtime we bill and not pay us for it. All about the PNL.

Since the outsourcing to India boom started I have seen and worked with many off shore teams. It is very obvious that this company is owned and operated from and by resources from India. They think they are better than everyone else, that they add some value that does not exist, and refuse to accept that basically they are just the cheapest guys in town. They have major ethics issues which spawn every facet of the organization from finance to human resources to sales. They fail to meet goals on fixed bid engaments and sell clients on a track record of success that does not exist. The claim to have expetise and experience in markets and SME that are false or created with no backing.
